results.title: A Choice of two
results.creator_credit: John Howe and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: White-collar crime and corporate in-fighting merge as a chairman of the board must choose his successor from between two competent executives. All eyes are on the contenders when it is discovered that a defrauding of Farabee Industries is being orchestrated by someone within the arena of power. This drama was based on an actual case history and looks at an aspect of business ethics. Stars Leslie Nielsen. (Awards: Toronto)

results.title: A Child in his country = Un Enfant un pays
results.creator_credit: Pierre Moretti, Rene Jodoin, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A childhood fantasy where dreams carry a boy far to adventure. It is an animated film in a contemporary style, employing drawn backgrounds, inserts of photographs, and successions of the same pictures to suggest movement. The most animated figure is the boy. He arrives in Canada on an ocean liner and is, in turn, a hunter of polar bear, a cowboy, a hockey star, and a swimmer. (Award: Toronto.)

results.title: A century of responsible government [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Dixon, Government of Victoria and Cine Service
results.brief_description: On 21st November, 1956, Victoria celebrated the centenary of responsible government in that State. To mark the occasion, the fortieth session of Parliament was formally opened by Sir Dallas Brookes, Governor of Victoria. At the ceremony Sir Dallas read a congratulatory message from the Queen and part of the speech made by Lieutenant McArthur when he opened the first Victorian Parliament in 1856. Also available on VHS [001846].

results.title: A Century of fantastic cinema: an interactive history of science fiction and horror films (PC)
results.brief_description: Join Eddie Munster (Butch Patrick) as he leads you on a fascinating tour of horror and science fiction films, starting from the early silent days and leading into the 1980’s. You can look through the poster gallery and see some great pictures and eerie sound and voice tracks; check out celebrity profiles; see what’s on at the theatre and peruse the souvenirs, all from the comfort of your own home.

results.title: A Catalyst for development, K.T.T.C.
results.creator_credit: Kenneth McCready and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Kenya is vitally concerned with education. With the help of the Canadian International Development Agency, the government built the Kenya Technical Teachers’ College (K.T.T.C.), where it trains people to teach at every level of technical education. Once trained, these teachers go out to the numerous village polytechnics situated throughout Kenya and teach their skills. By teaching trade skills to villagers, local industries may be developed and technology will be introduced to the country.

results.title: A Cat's world
results.creator_credit: Robert Khodadad and Wall to Wall Television
results.brief_description: A Cat’s World is a fascinating foray into feline behaviour, examining how cats both perceive and react to the world around them by observing these mysterious creatures in domestic situations and in the wild beyond the home. Through the use of innovative camera techniques, the viewer can discover how cat senses function, and learn more about cat behaviour through the interpretation of visual cues.

results.title: A Case of eggs
results.creator_credit: Bernard Devlin, John Smith, Daisy Bellefeuille and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a fast-moving spoof centred around Bruno, the moonlighter who despairs over his striking hens; Dean Goodspeak who hires Frances and Rita, of the Sisters of Detective Agency, to investigate the erratic behaviour of scientist Dr Morrow, a mysterious stranger; and David, the academic drop-out who is nursing a broken heart on his boat. An intriguing mystery story with an “all’s well that ends well” finish. Cast includes Peter Haworth, Micki Mansel, Jo Kirkpatrick and Bill Reiter. Packaged for Teaching English as a Second Language.

results.title: A Beethoven sonata
results.brief_description: One of Beethoven’s earliest works is finely played and recorded in this film. Dennis Brain (horn) and Dennis Matthews (piano) give a performance of the Sonata in F for horn and piano, Opus 17. Contrasts the horn as it was in Beethoven’s time with the improved and more complicated instrument of to-day. No other credits available.

results.title: A Career in bricklaying
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film emphasizes the positive aspects of work in bricklaying. As in most career films the less-favourable side of the work is omitted. Bricklayers are shown learning the trade, and the application of bricklaying skills is depicted in various constructions including ornamental brickwork, arches, and brickwork in high-rise buildings. Suitable for secondary school level.
